methods.name: Log
methods.description: A log is a named collection of entries, each entry representing a timestamped event. Logs can be produced by Google Cloud Platform services, by third-party services, or by your applications. For example, the log apache-access is produced by the Apache Web Server, but the log compute.googleapis.com/activity_log is produced by Google Compute Engine.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

methods.name: alert
methods.description:
Write a log entry with a severity of "ALERT".

This is a simple wrapper around logging/log#write. All arguments are the same as documented there.

methods.name: critical
methods.description:
Write a log entry with a severity of "CRITICAL".

This is a simple wrapper around logging/log#write. All arguments are the same as documented there.

methods.name: debug
methods.description:
Write a log entry with a severity of "DEBUG".

This is a simple wrapper around logging/log#write. All arguments are the same as documented there.

methods.name: emergency
methods.description:
Write a log entry with a severity of "EMERGENCY".

This is a simple wrapper around logging/log#write. All arguments are the same as documented there.

methods.name: entry
methods.description:
Create an entry object for this log.

Note that using this method will not itself make any API requests. You will use the object returned in other API calls, such as logging/log#write.

params.name: data
params.description: • The data to use as the value for this log entry.

methods.name: error
methods.description:
Write a log entry with a severity of "ERROR".

This is a simple wrapper around logging/log#write. All arguments are the same as documented there.

methods.name: getEntries
methods.description: This method is a wrapper around logging#getEntries, but with a filter specified to only return entries from this log.

examples.caption: To control how many API requests are made and page through the results manually, set autoPaginate to false.
Get the entries from your project as a readable object stream.
If you anticipate many results, you can end a stream early to prevent unnecessary processing and API requests.

params.name: options.filter
params.description: • An advanced logs filter. An empty filter matches all log entries.

params.name: options.maxApiCalls
params.description: • Maximum number of API calls to make.

params.name: options.orderBy
params.description: • How the results should be sorted, timestamp (oldest first) and timestamp desc (newest first, default).

params.name: options.pageToken
params.description: • A previously-returned page token representing part of the larger set of results to view.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.

params.name: callback.nextQuery
params.description: • If present, query with this object to check for more results.

methods.name: info
methods.description:
Write a log entry with a severity of "INFO".

This is a simple wrapper around logging/log#write. All arguments are the same as documented there.

methods.name: notice
methods.description:
Write a log entry with a severity of "NOTICE".

This is a simple wrapper around logging/log#write. All arguments are the same as documented there.

methods.name: warning
methods.description:
Write a log entry with a severity of "WARNING".

This is a simple wrapper around logging/log#write. All arguments are the same as documented there.

methods.name: write
methods.description:
Write log entries to Cloud Logging.

While you may write a single entry at a time, batching multiple entries together is preferred to avoid reaching the queries per second limit.

examples.caption: You may also pass multiple log entries to write.
To save some steps, you can also pass in plain values as your entries. Note, however, that you must provide a configuration object to specify the resource.

params.name: entry
params.description: • A log entry, or array of entries, to write.

params.name: options.resource
params.description: • A default monitored resource for entries where one isn't specified.

params.name: callback.err
params.description: • An error returned while making this request.
